name: Volumes Full in Week Based on Daily Use Rate
description: This PromQL query measures the rate at which volumes are filling up based on the daily use rate over the past week.
question: What is the daily rate at which volumes are filling up over the past week?

name: Volumes Full in Week Based on Daily Use Rate
description: This PromQL query measures the rate at which volumes are filling up based on the daily use rate over the past week.
question: Are there any abnormal spikes in volume filling rate over the past week?

name: Volumes Full in Week Based on Daily Use Rate
description: This PromQL query measures the rate at which volumes are filling up based on the daily use rate over the past week.
question: How does the current volume filling rate compare to the average rate over the past week?

name: Running PVCs Above % Used Warning Threshold
description: This PromQL query measures the number of Persistent Volume Claims (PVCs) that are currently utilizing storage above a specified warning threshold percentage.
question: How many PVCs are currently using storage above the warning threshold?

name: Running PVCs Above % Used Warning Threshold
description: This PromQL query measures the number of Persistent Volume Claims (PVCs) that are currently utilizing storage above a specified warning threshold percentage.
question: Which PVCs are consuming storage beyond the warning threshold?

name: Running PVCs Above % Used Warning Threshold
description: This PromQL query measures the number of Persistent Volume Claims (PVCs) that are currently utilizing storage above a specified warning threshold percentage.
question: What is the total storage utilization percentage of PVCs above the warning threshold?

name: Unbound PVCs
description: This PromQL query measures the number of PVCs (Persistent Volume Claims) that are unbound in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: How many PVCs are currently unbound in the cluster?

name: Unbound PVCs
description: This PromQL query measures the number of PVCs (Persistent Volume Claims) that are unbound in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: Which namespaces have unbound PVCs?

name: Unbound PVCs
description: This PromQL query measures the number of PVCs (Persistent Volume Claims) that are unbound in the Kubernetes cluster.
